DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare patient centered- outcome Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) three location treat urinary urge incontinence . One location along tibial nerve , traditionally access near medial malleolus . The second site sacral nerve access sacrum . The third site sham site shoulder . This study evaluate feasibility transcutaneous electrical stimulation treatment overactive bladder .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation Overactive Bladder
DOC.criteria: Patients clinically diagnose urge incontinence , define urinary leakage associate sudden , strong desire pas urine difficult defer . Patients urge predominant mixed incontinence . Patients need answer `` Yes '' `` leakage related feeling urgency '' UDI 6 questionnaire . Female Over 18 year age . English speak able give inform consent participate study . Patients four urinary incontinence episode . Stress incontinence desire surgical management . Previous treatment refractory urge incontinence PTNS , SNS , Intradetrusor onabotulinumtoxin A injection . Neurological condition affect continence multiple sclerosis , history spinal shock within past year , neurologic impairment require wheelchair . Urethral diverticulum . Daily catheterization due urinary retention . The use anticholinergic medication less 6 week . Patients pacemaker place . Patients limited mobility require wheelchair . Elevated PVR > 200 cc Untreated urinary tract infection , define symptom urine culture great 100,000 cfu/ ml within last 1 month prior treatment . Uncorrected Stage 3 prolapse .
